intro: Oreophilus pholeter, commonly known as the mountain pholeter, is a rare and unique plant species native to high-altitude regions. It thrives in cool, moist environments, often found in mountainous areas with rich, well-drained soil. The plant features a compact, herbaceous structure with broad, waxy leaves that help retain moisture. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically displaying shades of white and pale blue. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a sensitive indicator of environmental health.
